node.title: 'My own language is not spoken by my community': The fight to save Indigenous languages
node.alt: A group of people standing out in the countryside talking. Two cars are in the background
node.description: There are more than 250 Indigenous languages in Australia but only about 12 are still spoken regularly across different generations within communities.
node.content:
["Almost half of the world's 6,511 languages are now endangered, according to a recent study published in the scientific\u00a0journal Nature.\u00a0", "Without immediate intervention, over 1,500 of these languages could be lost by the end of the century.", "Unfortunately Australia has one of the worst records in the world\u00a0when it comes to language loss.", "There are more than 250 Indigenous languages in Australia\u00a0but, according to a\u00a0AIATSIS 2018\u201319 survey, only 123 Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander languages are still in use.", "Of those, only about 12 are relatively strong and being taught to children.\u00a0", "\"It's very depressing,\" says Professor Jakelin\u00a0Troy, a Ngarigu\u00a0woman and linguist at the University of Sydney.", "\"From a First Nations point of view, as an Aboriginal person, a Ngarigu\u00a0person in Australia, my own language is not spoken by my community, \" she tells ABC RN Breakfast.", "\"There are a few people who know a little bit about the language\u00a0and ... do speak it\u00a0but they don't share it.\"", "
Losing a language per month
", "Professor Felicity Meakins is a linguist at the University of Queensland\u00a0and one of the authors of the recent study.", "She says, without further action, language loss could triple in the next four years. That's equivalent to losing a language per month for the rest of the century.", "\"Most of those languages that are endangered are spoken by marginalised minority communities, so Indigenous languages are really the focus of this study,\" Professor\u00a0Meakins says.", "", "The study also illuminated\u00a0the socio-political history of many countries.", "\"For instance, in Australia, languages have been silenced as the result of brutal colonial policies,\" she says.", "\"People were punished for speaking their language, children were placed in dormitories\u00a0and we have the Stolen Generations, which really changed that ability to pass languages onto kids.\"", "These traumatic experiences had lasting consequences on many First Nations people's ability to pass on languages.", "\"It really shows that we need to build curriculums that support bilingual education and wonderful language nests programs so that both Indigenous language proficiency and English language proficiency is supported,\" she says.", "
A hunger to learn\u00a0
", "Professor Troy says older generations were scared into not speaking their language.", "\"Sharing the language was seen to be something that if you passed your language on to the next generation, it was going to cause them the same kind of horror that these older people had been through,\" she says.", "", "
Professor Jakelin Troy is working to save Indigenous Australian languages.(Supplied\u00a0)
", "But that is beginning to change, she adds, and her community is starting to use their language again.", "\"Our language is not a language that has no future,\" she says. \"But the future is in our hands.\"", "She'd like to see Indigenous people worldwide encouraged and supported by their governments to speak their languages. That could be languages used for every purpose every day by every age group or\u00a0individuals wanting to work with the community to speak language again.", "She's doing it herself.\u00a0\"I can now sing a snow increase ceremony song [a corroboree song\u00a0traditionally sung by Indigenous women to bring the snow]\u00a0in my language,\u00a0I greet people in my language, I can introduce myself in my language.", "\"Last year, I couldn't do that. It doesn't take very long to get a language going again, but people need to be supported to do that.\"", "And Professor Troy is doing what she can to help this along. She designed an Aboriginal language K-10 syllabus for all school ages.\u00a0She was also\u00a0a lead writer on the Australian curriculum for language, focusing on the framework for teaching Aboriginal and Torres Strait Island languages.\u00a0", "\"The purpose of having those curriculum documents in Australia \u2014 and we've got similar ones in all the state and territory jurisdictions as well as the national one \u2014 is to say that every school in Australia can teach an Australian language,\" she says, referring to\u00a0Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander languages.", "", "
Professor Jaky Troy has learnt a traditional snow increase song in Indigenous language.\u00a0(Supplied: Jaky Troy)
", "There are now thousands of students studying an Aboriginal language at school in Australia, she adds.", "\"Young Australians love \u2026 being Australian [and] engaging with who and what we, as the Indigenous people of Australia, are. They want to be part of it.", "\"They know it's no longer the case that ... the nation state [are] trying to rub us out, which is what was going on in the very recent past, even in my own lifetime.\"", "
The world is watching
", "UNESCO's Decade of Indigenous Languages begins in 2022, and it's likely Australia will come under scrutiny during this time, Professor Meakins says.", "\"Currently, Australia has the dubious distinction of having one of the highest rates of language loss worldwide, and international attention is going to be drawn to us in that UNESCO decade,\" she says.", "Like Professor Troy, she wants languages to find their place in schools.", "But she'd also like Indigenous languages to be spoken across a wide variety of domains, including within land-based practices and artistic practices.", "She points to examples such as\u00a0Kylie and Clint Bracknell,\u00a0Noongar people from Western Australia, who have been translating films and versions of Macbeth into the Noongar language.", "In Queensland, Indigenous artists Sonja and Elisa Jane Carmichael have also attempted to renew\u00a0traditional language in their work.\u00a0 \u00a0 \u00a0 \u00a0 \u00a0 \u00a0", "\"Language has its place in all of these domains. It's not just school,\" she says.", "\"School is really, really important, and it's an equaliser for children. But also I'd love to see language really filling all of the domains where it belongs.\""]
